meanings.definition: A small, hard, dry fruit or seed, especially a seed of a pine tree.
meanings.sent1: The forest floor was covered with fallen ascons from the pine trees.
meanings.sent2: She picked up the ascons and placed them in a basket.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the ascons for acorns and tried to bury them.
meanings.sent4: The ascons on the ground resembled tiny pebbles in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The ascons crunched underfoot as they walked through the woods.

meanings.definition: To gather or collect in a heap or mass.
meanings.sent1: He began to ascons the fallen leaves into a neat pile.
meanings.sent2: The children helped to ascons the toys back into the toy chest.
meanings.sent3: She decided to ascons all her old clothes for donation.
meanings.sent4: The team managed to ascons enough evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to ascons the scattered tools before leaving the site.

meanings.sent1: Over time, she was able to ascons a large collection of stamps.
meanings.sent2: They planned to ascons enough money for their dream vacation.
meanings.sent3: He seemed to ascons bad luck wherever he went.
meanings.sent4: The company hoped to ascons a loyal customer base.
meanings.sent5: She managed to ascons enough points to win the game.
